title: Investing in Space: Why the Pentagon is spending billions to build its own satellite constellation
summary: Low Earth orbit satellite constellations are all the rage, but up to this point they’ve been the prospective domain of commercial entities.

title: Ship 25 awaits rollout for full-stack of Starship Flight 2
summary: Starship is getting close to its second Integrated Flight Test (IFT). Booster 9 completed its pre-flight testing and now awaits its partner for the second launch. Since Ship 25 was already tested months ago, this only leaves full stack testing and pending regulatory approval for the second flight.

title: The Future Of Hypersonic Flight | TLP Exclusive Tour & Interview
summary: TLP's Founder and Network Director, Zac Aubert, was invited inside Space Engine Systems' (SES) Design And Assembly Of Turbo Ramjet Engine Shop in Alberta, Canada for an exclusive first look at their DASS GNC engine and had the chance to sit down with SES President and Chief Technology Officer, Pradeep Dass!

title: QinetiQ wins $224 million contract to provide technical services to Space Development Agency
summary: QinetiQ US, a defense contractor based in Lorton, Virginia, was awarded a $224 million contract to provide systems engineering and technical support to the Space Development Agency.

title: EU Member States Commit to Not Test Direct-Ascent ASAT Systems
summary:
A document published by the UN Open-Ended Working Group on Reducing Space Threats outlines the commitment of 27 EU member states to ban all direct-ascent anti-satellite tests. “Concerned that the use of destructive ASAT systems might have widespread and irreversible impacts on the outer space environment, the Member States of the EU consider such commitment […]
The post EU Member States Commit to Not Test Direct-Ascent ASAT Systems appeared first on European Spaceflight.
